examples: to unfold a map; to unfold a tablecloth; She unpacks the new dress and unfolds it carefully.
The curtains unfolded to reveal the stage.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To turn out ; to happen ; to develop .
examples: Events unfolded in an unexpected way.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To lay open to view or contemplation; to bring out in all the details, or by successive development; to reveal .
examples: to unfold one's designs;  to unfold the principles of a science

definitions.definition: ( transitive , computing ) To reassemble a line of text that was split across multiple lines.

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To turn out ; to happen ; to develop .
( transitive ) To lay open to view or contemplation; to bring out in all the details, or by successive development; to reveal .
( transitive , computing ) To reassemble a line of text that was split across multiple lines.

definitions.definition: To release from a fold or pen .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To release from a fold or pen .
